Subject: Creating Safe Spaces
Description: How can we create safe spaces for people of all varieties at the convention, and in our lives outside of fandom? Join a discussion with our staff (including the con chair) and those who have ideas on how we can do better on inclusivity and promoting consent.  Speakers include:Nuri Gocay, April Nance, Scott Kennedy, Mark Oshiro, Mari Brighe - Track: Penguicon Events  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: LGBT Alphabet Soup
Description: The words we use to describe ourselves are an important part of our identiy. This panel will examine the many different terms used within the LGBT Community and what they mean.  Speakers include:Mari Brighe, Cassy Sinke, April Nance, Mark Oshiro - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Everything You Thought You Knew About Genetics is A Lie
Description: Most of what you learned in your basic biology classes about genetics isn't actually true. From independent assortment to acquired trait inheritance to the Central Dogma itself, advances in technology and new discoveries have turned the traditional basic teachings of genetics on their head. We'll explore many of these oversimplifications and you'll get a chance to ask if things you thought were real are just convenient science fibs!  Speakers include:Mari Brighe - Track: Science  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector

Subject: LGBT in Fandom
Description: Join us for a group discussion on LGBT/Queer Culture within fandom. With a moderator guiding the discussion, we will share and discuss our experiences of being gender and/or sexual minorities within various fandoms. Let us talk about the challenges we have faced, the successes we have seen, and the opportunities there are for improving inclusivity and diversity within fandom. Those who attended the panel last year will want to join us again! As with any place at Penguicon, bigotry and harassment will not be tolerated.  Speakers include:Mari Brighe, Cassy Sinke, April Nance, Mark Oshiro - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
